intro: Perinerion, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Perinerion laeve, which is native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compound leaves with three leaflets. It grows as a small shrub or tree, often found in dry, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, Perinerion has attracted interest for conservation and horticultural purposes.
